definition: to ride the dragon/to die (of emperors and kings)
four horse military chariot (archaic)/four (archaic)/generic term for history books
to ride/to mount/to make use of/to avail oneself of/to take advantage of/to multiply (math.)/Buddhist sect or creed

sentences.english: She made up her mind to find a good husband for her daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她决心要为女儿寻找一位乘龙快婿。

sentences.english: President Bush is praising his new son-in-law as a quote "really good guy" .
sentences.chinese: 据称布什总统称赞到自己的新女婿为“乘龙快婿”。

definition: variant of 御[yu4]/to drive/to manage/to control
heavy truck (abbr. for 重型卡車|重型卡车)
to ride the wind/to use a fair wind/to take an opportunity
kun 鯤|鲲[kun1] and peng 鵬|鹏[Peng2], mythological beasts/peng, a gigantic bird transformed from the kun
to carry a passenger/(of spaceships etc) manned/also pr. [zai3 ren2]

luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
